frame.name: FR_Renunciation
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Cognizer</fen> comes to think that some <fen>Eventuality</fen> is no longer an objective, or accepts not to have some <fen>Benefit</fen> any more. The Eventuality can be some course of action that the Cognizer decides not to perform or have performed by someone, or state that should no longer hold, or cognitive stance the Cognizer no longer has.
<ex>That will only be possible if and when <fex name="spe">the IRA</fex> <t>renounces</t> <fex name="evt">armed struggle</fex>.</ex>
<ex></ex> <asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : Modification of the Renunciation frame: the Content FE was split into Benefit / Eventuality. </def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who communicates their cessation of association with the <fen>Content</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Eventuality
FE.definition:
<def-root>The eventuality that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> no longer considers as an objective.
<ex>FR-EX: Ils <t>renouncent</t> à ce que <fex name="evt">l'association leur rembourse les frais</fex>.</ex> <ex>FR-EX: <fex name="evt">Ils</fex> <t>renouncent</t> à <fex name="evt">poursuivre l'association</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Benefit
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> accepts not to benefit from anymore.
<ex>FR-EX: L'état <t>renouncera</t> à <fex name="Benefit">ce privilège</fex>.</ex> </def-root>
